image.altText: a skyline with houses

items.synopsis: Interest rates climb above 4 per cent for the first time in more than 11 years, as the Reserve Bank moves aggressively to clamp down on inflation.

title.children: 'The risk of a hard landing has grown today': Economists warn latest rate rise may go too far

image.altText: Business people walk outside the Reserve Bank of Australia.

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank has increased the cash rate to 4.1 per cent at its June meeting, citing "persistent" and "ongoing" high inflation, while the ASX shed 1.2 per cent in response to the decision. Look back on the day's developments with our blog.

title.children: Reserve Bank lifts cash rate to 4.1pc, but won't rule out 'further tightening' to tackle inflation — as it happened

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing an orange shirt.

items.synopsis: An Australian man accused of going on a naked, drunken rampage in Indonesia will be released from prison today after more than a month in detention.

title.children: Australian accused of drunken rampage in Indonesia will return home after being released from prison

image.altText: Chau with his mother-in-law, wife Trang and son Daniel.

items.synopsis: The family of a retired Sydney baker jailed in Vietnam for 12 years on "terrorism" offences express new hope for his freedom after Anthony Albanese's visit to the South-East Asian nation.

title.children: 'She cannot wait to see her husband again': New hopes for Australian detained in Vietnam, after PM's visit

image.altText: A satellite image of a dam wall rupture unleashing a flood of water.

items.synopsis: A vast Soviet-era dam in the Russian controlled part of southern Ukraine was blown up on Tuesday, unleashing a flood of water across the war zone, according to both Ukrainian and Russian forces.

title.children: Massive Soviet-era dam in Russian-controlled Ukraine blown up, region being evacuated

image.altText: Two middle aged women leaning together with big smiles

items.synopsis: Ms Folbigg spent her first day of freedom since 2003 enjoying simple pleasures, like a comfortable bed and pizza, her best friend Tracy Chapman says.

title.children: Kathleen Folbigg 'extremely humbled' and 'grateful' after release

image.altText: a woman lying on the green grass with a baby by her side

items.synopsis: Extensive scientific and medical evidence proved to be key to setting Kathleen Folbigg free, 20 years after she was convicted of killing her four children.

title.children: The one-in-35-million mutation and the science that set Kathleen Folbigg free

image.altText: A suburban street; a white, one-storey house on the left and an unfinished two-storey house on the right

items.synopsis: The construction industry insolvency crisis is sweeping the nation, and it's devastating for both consumers and builders. So what can be done about it?

title.children: Builders go bust in record numbers, leaving thousands of Australian home owners in the lurch

image.altText: A man in a suit walkig out of court.

items.synopsis: A "veteran of brothels" convicted of raping, choking and spitting in the mouth of a sex worker at a Canberra brothel, has walked free from court after being sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court today.

title.children: 'Veteran of brothels' who raped and choked Canberra sex worker walks free

image.altText: A man in a cap walks down some stairs holding rail

items.synopsis: A court hears paedophile John Wayne Millwood transferred more than $800,000 to his former partner and daughter the same day he was sentenced for sexually abusing a person who is now in a legal fight to claim a $6 million compensation payout.

title.children: Convicted paedophile tells bankruptcy hearing cancer diagnosis prompted asset shed

image.altText: Tasmanian petrol prices falling

items.synopsis: A Tasmanian man who used a company fuel card to buy more than $24,000 worth of fuel, some of which he onsold to friends, avoids prison — the court acknowledging his marriage breakdown caused "great upheaval" for him before the offending started.

title.children: Man uses employer's fuel card to unlawfully buy more than $20k of petrol

image.altText: The roots of a branch photographed against the cracked, dry earth.

items.synopsis: The odds of a warm, dry winter and spring have shortened after the Bureau of Meteorology took its El Niño warning to a new level.

title.children: Bureau declares El Niño alert, signalling higher chance of warm, dry weather

image.altText: woman looks lovingly at her chihuahua puppy who fits in her hand

items.synopsis: New laws require a landlord to give a reason for refusing a tenant's request to have a pet, like if the animal is dangerous or the property is too small for it.

title.children: When Kelly was told she couldn't have a dog in her rental property, she wanted to know why

image.altText: A young man.

items.synopsis: Joel Russo, who was only months out of prison when he repeatedly raped a female jogger on the banks of Melbourne's Merri Creek is jailed for more than 20 years.

title.children: Serial rapist jailed for 'horrendous' attack on female jogger along Melbourne creek

image.altText: A dry lake bed.

items.synopsis: Scientists say we need to make 'very rapid and very large' emissions cuts as atmospheric CO2 jumps to an all-time high at the Mauna Loa Atmospheric Baseline Observatory.

title.children: At Hawaii's Mauna Loa observatory, CO2 levels have broken a new record

image.altText: A man with long, blonde, curly hair, poses and smiles at a camera, wearing a pattern shirt, standing in front of a window.

items.synopsis: Scott Phillip White will be sentenced on Thursday for the manslaughter of Scott Johnson, whose body was found at the base of cliffs at Manly in 1988.

title.children: 'No leniency': Man urges maximum jail term for brother's killer after 35yo mystery solved

image.altText: a man wearing a suit standing in front of video and photo cameras

items.synopsis: The full findings into the Victoria Cross recipient's unsuccessful defamation lawsuit are now public, and outline Justice Anthony Besanko's reasoning. Here are five findings you may have missed.

title.children: Five key findings from the Ben Roberts-Smith judgement

image.altText: A man wearing a car backwards stands by a bright green car, with its doors open.

items.synopsis: A man accused of threatening Nick Kyrgios's mother at gunpoint and stealing her son's car, pleads not guilty to aggravated armed robbery in the ACT Magistrates Court.

title.children: Canberra man pleads not guilty to pointing gun at Nick Kyrgios's mother and stealing tennis star's Tesla

image.altText: A woman holding bills outside a house

items.synopsis: Mia De Rauch says she has "no more time to give" as she runs a video production business and works hospitality shifts to keep up with increasing mortgage repayments and bills.

title.children: Rates rise smashes business owner already working two jobs

image.altText: A tram passing with two people walking next to it

items.synopsis: They increase property prices, take cars off the road, and governments are keen to splash millions on rolling them out in rapidly growing cities. But light rail is facing increasingly vocal local opposition.

title.children: This urban planner says light rail is a 'magnificent' opportunity. Why are communities so against it?

image.altText: young man with brown hair wearing hooded jacket while using vape

items.synopsis: Although New Zealand has one of the lowest rates of adult smoking in the OECD, it has banned future generations from smoking in a push to be "smoke-free" by 2025.

title.children: New Zealand bans vape names, considers plain packaging to help curb vaping amongst young people

image.altText: Scott Morrison looks to the left as he speaks in front of a dark backdrop with an Australian flag to the left.

items.synopsis: A review into a Morrison-government-era grant funding program finds only two of 171 projects attached to the program were "highly suitable" and almost half were based in marginal electorates.

title.children: Report finds Morrison government's administration of health program 'fell short of ethical requirements'

image.altText: Comet the dolphin underwater going to eat a fish with its mouth open

items.synopsis: The handfeeding of wild dolphins is a lucrative ecotourism industry in parts of Australia, but the impact of the practice has researchers divided. So, why are experts split on the issue, and what does the science say?

title.children: Wild dolphin feeding programs can be pretty divisive. These are the arguments for and against them

image.altText: An older Asian woman with blonde hair, wearing jewellery and a sheer top.

items.synopsis: Shay died from a stroke, according to a family statement provided to The Associated Press on Monday.

title.children: Anna Shay, breakout star of reality series Bling Empire, dead at 62

image.altText: Ada under a blanket on the couch looking miserable, while a cat sits on her lap.

items.synopsis: Healthcare workers have warned the flu season has arrived early this year and is hitting young kids harder than usual.

title.children: From 32,000 to 68,000 cases in five weeks: Flu season is spiking early. Doctors say children could be at risk

image.altText: A man sitting on a rock inside a cave.

items.synopsis: Palaeontologists say they found the oldest known burial site in the world, containing remains of a small-brained distant relative of humans previously thought incapable of complex behaviour.

title.children: World's oldest burial site found in South Africa, dating back to at least 200,000 BC

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith receives Victoria Cross

items.synopsis: The Ben Roberts-Smith verdict has reopened the wounds of a shameful period of Australian military history that demonstrates how the leadership of the ADF has failed, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: Three ADF failures built the culture that enabled Ben Roberts-Smith

image.altText: Abel Tesfaye and Lily Rose Depp in The Idol, with Tesfaye holding Depp from behind.

items.synopsis: A troubled young pop star manipulated and taken advantage of by a sinister impresario. We've seen it before — and some say we've seen it done much better. Why is there so much controversy surrounding HBO's The Idol?

title.children: HBO's The Idol finally dropped and it's being described as a 'toxic man's fantasy'

image.altText: A close up of Angus speaking against a dark blue background.

items.synopsis: Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor says Australia has higher core inflation than all of the countries in the G7. Is that correct? RMIT ABC Fact Check investigates.

title.children: Fact check: Is Australia's core inflation higher than all countries in the G7?

image.altText: Police radar gun

items.synopsis: Anders Wiklöf says he really regrets driving 30 kilometres per hour over the limit in Finland, where such penalties are based an offender's income.

title.children: Driver slapped with $195,796 speeding fine in Finland

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein in his 2017 mug shot.

items.synopsis: More than 4,000 pages of documents related to the disgraced financier's death have been obtained under the Freedom of Information Act, including a detailed psychological reconstruction of the events leading to his suicide in prison.

title.children: New details about events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death revealed in documents

image.altText: A woman holding an old photo of a man from the war

items.synopsis: Denise Carr's father rarely talked about the atrocities he endured during four years at Changi prison. She is now getting rare insight into his time behind enemy lines.

title.children: Hidden diaries unlock dad's WWII Changi prisoner of war suffering

image.altText: Cate Blanchett, a middle-aged white woman in a nun's habit, and Aswan Reid, a young Aboriginal boy, run through a wheat field.

items.synopsis: In its 70th year, the festival program boasts almost 300 films — from international heavy hitters and award-winners to lesser-known gems and trailblazing debuts. Here are nine you can't miss.

title.children: Cate Blanchett as a renegade nun, Meg Ryan in an erotic thriller: Sydney Film Festival highlights
